books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.description: Embark on a magical journey with Harry Potter, a young wizard discovering his identity. Written by J.K. Rowling, this fantasy novel introduces readers to the enchanting world of Hogwarts, spells, and friendship.
books.author: J.K. Rowling

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy, 'The Lord of the Rings,' takes readers on a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron. A timeless tale of friendship, courage, and the battle between good and evil.
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

books.title: Frankenstein
books.description: Mary Shelley's 'Frankenstein' is a Gothic masterpiece that explores the consequences of playing god. Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist, creates a creature that becomes a symbol of humanity's hubris.
books.author: Mary Shelley

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.description: Emily Brontë's 'Wuthering Heights' is a passionate tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors. Heathcliff and Catherine's intense, doomed romance unfolds in this classic work of English literature.
books.author: Emily Brontë

books.title: The Odyssey
books.description: Homer's 'The Odyssey' is an ancient Greek epic poem that follows Odysseus' journey home after the Trojan War. Filled with adventure, mythical creatures, and divine intervention, it is a cornerstone of Western literature.
books.author: Homer

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.description: Oscar Wilde's only novel, 'The Picture of Dorian Gray,' explores the consequences of a life of hedonism. Dorian Gray remains eternally youthful while his portrait ages, reflecting the moral decay hidden behind his beauty.
books.author: Oscar Wilde

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's 'The Brothers Karamazov' delves into complex questions of morality, faith, and the nature of existence. The Karamazov brothers grapple with their relationships and their father's legacy.
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov copy
books.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's 'The Brothers Karamazov' delves into complex questions of morality, faith, and the nature of existence. The Karamazov brothers grapple with their relationships and their father's legacy.
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.description: Alexandre Dumas' 'The Count of Monte Cristo' is a riveting tale of revenge and redemption. Edmond Dantès, betrayed and imprisoned, escapes to enact justice on those who wronged him.
books.author: Alexandre Dumas

books.title: The Jungle Book
books.description: Rudyard Kipling's 'The Jungle Book' is a collection of captivating stories set in the Indian jungle. Follow Mowgli, Baloo, and Bagheera as they navigate the challenges of the wild and encounter unforgettable characters.
books.author: Rudyard Kipling

books.title: Coding with JavaScript For Dummies
books.description: Go from beginner to builder quickly with this hands-on JavaScript guide Coding with JavaScript For Dummies provides easy, hands-on instruction for anyone looking to learn this popular client-side language.
books.author: Chris Minnick and Eva Holland

orders.title: The Great Gatsby
orders.description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald
orders.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

orders.title: The Brothers Karamazov
orders.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's 'The Brothers Karamazov' delves into complex questions of morality, faith, and the nature of existence. The Karamazov brothers grapple with their relationships and their father's legacy.
orders.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
